title: Comparing the Polarity of Pentane and 1-Pentanol
credits: This interactive was created by the [Concord Consortium](https://concord.org/) using our [Next-Generation Molecular Workbench](http://mw.concord.org/nextgen/) software, with funding by a grant from [Google.org](https://www.google.org/).
This interactive also uses [JSMol](https://sourceforge.net/projects/jsmol/), licensed under the [LGPL](http://www.gnu.org/licenses/lgpl.html) license.
about: Pentane and 1-pentanol differ by only a single atom. Investigate the striking effect on their polarity.

onLoad: post('jsmolScript', 'm0: set background black; moveto 0.0 { -17 505 863 38.7} 78.3 1.8 20.4 {4.46 0.16149986 -8.565499} 4.7; isosurface reversecolor colorscheme "rwb" solvent 0.1 resolution 6 map mep; color isosurface translucent; set echo top center; set echo IMAGE "models/pentanol/pentaneComp.png";');

post('jsmolScript', 'm1: set background black; moveto 0.0 { -1000 -11 22 173.6} 80.0 -1.5 20.1 {12.19285 -10.99115 -1.0716001} 5.3; isosurface reversecolor colorscheme "rwb" solvent 0.1 resolution 6 map mep; color isosurface translucent; set echo top center; set echo IMAGE "models/pentanol/pentanolComp.png";');
